#summary The input disabled attribute is way of declaring that a form field is disabled.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [InputElement <input> element] > *disabled attribute*

== Usage ==

{{{
<input disabled>
<input disabled=disabled>
}}}

Users cannot interact with disabled inputs, and these inputs will not be included during form submission.

== Values ==

This attribute is stand-alone; it can be present with no value, or it can have its own name as its value.

== Elements ==

You can use the `disabled` attribute on the following elements:

  * [AElement <a>]
  * [AreaElement <area>]
  * [ButtonElement <button>]
  * [CommandElement <command>]
  * [DatagridElement <datagrid>]
  * [EmbedElement <embed>]
  * [InputElement <input>]
  * [LinkElement <link>]
  * [OptgroupElement <optgroup>]
  * [OptionElement <option>]
  * [SelectElement <select>]
  * [StyleElement <style>]
  * [TextareaElement <textarea>]
